abstracts.cdata!:
Overall, the outcome of both the
            Institution Building Loan (IBL) and Structural Adjustment
            Technical Assistance Credit (SATAC) was satisfactory. The
            Government was committed to a detailed program of
            interventions, and accomplished most of the projects'
            objectives. The Bank responded with a relevant technical
            assistance to Armenia's needs and built management
            capacity, enabling key reforms, for the transition to a
            private sector based economy. The key lessons suggest that
            countries undergoing transition, require broad technical
            assistance, targeting prioritized areas of intervention,
            preferably, through various operations so as to attain
            sustainability. Technical assistance (TA) efficiency was
            achieved, namely due to the country's policy reform
            commitment, and the Government's selectivity and
            ownership of TA. Although the inclusion of a tight timetable
            carries the disadvantage of possible implementation delays,
            with the further need for project extensions, it may
            however, be helpful in providing the right focus for needed
            reforms, precisely upon economic adversity, when mostly
            needed. The flexibility on project components during
            implementation, maximized the loan effectiveness, and
            contributed to positive impacts under changing
            circumstances, such as the funds reallocation for the Public
            Sector Reform and commercial bank work-outs.
